experience: You and Heidi both know Tania Katan

Responsible for bringing the patient perspective to all Rx4good client work through relationships with advocacy organizations, policy organizations and healthcare companies with a desire to meaningfully integrate the patient perspective into their work, processes and product development.
Critical Mass: Young Adult Cancer Alliance

First employee hired, responsible for guiding the launch of Critical Mass as an independent non-profit and for transitioning it out of the LIVESTRONG Foundation on to a path to achieve the vision of a world where AYAs with cancer have every resource to survive and thrive. Responsibilities include:• Develop and implement strategic and operational plans• Cultivate effective collaborations and partnerships that further the mission, vision and strategic goals• Create a structure that benefits a diverse base of health care professionals and patient advocates• Build a solid foundation for future sustainability, including good governance practices, operational infrastructure, fundraising and development• Serve as an effective ambassador for the AYA cause to the cancer community and general public

Responsible for evaluating sectors of interest and determining how to best position the Foundation as well as identify potential partners for collaboration. Specific projects include:• Assessing and managing the LIVESTRONG Global Envoy program of high-profile spokespeople• Developing a strategic framework for Foundation interaction with the pharmaceutical industry• Making recommendations for building the Foundation’s local presence in Austin • Internal liaison with partners at Genentech to oversee the development and launch of REV, a one-day, interactive forum to drive innovative thinking and collaborative action with key stakeholders across the cancer community.• Serving as a public spokesperson for the Foundation

Responsible for managing the Grassroots Engagement team and overseeing all aspects of grassroots advocacy for the foundation, including:• Developing an infrastructure and process to facilitate grassroots support for foundation initiatives• Building community to connect grassroots constituents, leaders, NGOs and other partners.• Ensuring that a range of engagement opportunities are offered to constituents wishing to support the work of the foundation.• Leveraging grassroots activities to support all LIVESTRONG initiatives.• Overseeing and expanding the grassroots training program.• Cultivating grassroots leadership and moving advocates into deeper levels of commitment over time.In addition to overseeing Grassroots Engagement, took on management of the newly-formed New Media team in 2010, with oversight of all digital activation and online properties, including:• Overseeing the staffing build-out of the New Media team to best support the work of the foundation.• Developing a comprehensive engagement infrastructure to promote initiatives across all online properties. • Creating innovative on- and off-line mechanisms for advocates to get and stay engaged• Concepting and executing email campaigns and social integration that reflects the broad range of the foundation’s work.• Ensuring a positive and consistent user interface/experience across all online properties

• Launched the first national non-profit organization with the stated mission of creating a community of peer support for young adults with cancer. • Created a uniquely irreverent brand for the community, giving an unmistakable voice and identity to young adults with cancer for the first time.• Launched My Planet Cancer, the world’s first online social networking community for young adults with cancer, in Feb. 2008, with nearly 2 million page views and 200,000 unique visitors in the first year. • Developed three groundbreaking weekend retreat programs: one for 18-25 year olds, one for 25-40 year olds and one for young couples. The latter two were the first-ever programs of their kind.• Partnered with the Lance Armstrong Foundation in 2004 to develop initial concept for the LIVESTRONG Young Adult Alliance, a national coalition of organizations working to improve survival rates and quality of life for young adults with cancer. • Developed the Planet Cancer Roadshow, delivering nearly 30 Grand Rounds presentations on young adult oncology at hospitals and cancer centers around the country to overwhelmingly positive evaluations.• Collaborated with medical faculty from Scott & White Hospital in Temple, Texas to develop and present annually a curriculum module addressing young adult oncology and doctor/patient interaction to first-year medical students at Texas A&M, 2004 to 2009.• Nationally-recognized speaker/presenter to both patient and professional organizations on young adult oncology, advocacy, and social media in nonprofits
Patient Advocate on the Adolescent Young Adult and the Digital Engagement Committees

Selected to represent the adolescent/young adult patient perspective in national cancer cooperative research group initiatives and to help develop a digital strategy for publicly funded cancer clinical research.

Fayruz Benyousef, CFRE
Philanthropy Expert & Strategist
May 9, 2010, Fayruz worked with Heidi but at different companies

Heidi is someone I was destined to meet.  Over 10 years ago we met when she asked me to adivse her on the work she was doing in her new nonprofit, Planet Cancer, for young adults affected by cancer.  As a young adult survivor, the mission of PC aligned with my personal mission to provide a forum for young adults.  Heidi's commitment, charm, and 'magical' ability to draw people to share her vision are among the few wonderful qualities that called me to be part of the Planet Cancer Board.  I've worked with her also in a professional capacity and she is a follow-through, hard working professional who always over-delivers.  The world is a better place because she is here.
Fayruz Benyousef, CFRE

Susan McClure
Founder & Publisher, Genome magazine
October 8, 2011, Heidi worked with Susan but at different companies

Susan is one of those people with the rare gift of building and developing business relationships with the mutual benefit of both parties in mind. Coupled with her unimpeachable integrity and strict attention to detail, this means that people who work with her quickly come to have enormous trust in her. Add in her ability to think both strategically and creatively, and it explains why both Susan's work and personal circles tend to be comprised of people who, like myself, will always look for chances to work with her, even as both our roles and situations have changed over time.

Philanthropy Expert & Strategist
May 8, 2010, Heidi was a client of Fayruz’s

I've worked with Fayruz and Dini Partners for many years now in several capacities, and they have always delivered in spades. One of the things I am most proud to have worked on with them is the LIVESTRONG Young Adult Alliance, which would not exist as it does today without their counsel. Their team excelled at bringing together a disparate group of stakeholders, all concerned with the issues of young adults with cancer, and helping us build a movement--from the first steps of identifying priorities and forming a cohesive, focused organizing committee, to building a strong foundation, to planning for future growth.”

summary: Successful leader devoted to changing the world, seasoned by two decades of work on two innovative social good start-ups. Affinity for strategic project development and dynamic teams where everyone takes turns emptying the trash. Gifted communicator, skilled at synthesizing complex information into compelling solutions, making unexpected connections, and uniting diverse stakeholders around a common vision.
name: Heidi (Schultz) Adams
title: Chief Patient Advocate at Rx4good
